trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Cave bullywugs have made their home in the deep places underground. They tend to be dark brown, olive green, light blue or even pigment-free albinos. Their eyes are pale in color, and their eyesight is adapted to the complete lack of sunlight in underground living. They are excellent scavengers and can survive on meager resources.
Source: Bullywugs p. 6 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Social Structure
trait.text:
Bullywug civilizations have a loose class system organized within a tribe-like framework. Warriors, gatherers, tadpole caretakers, shaman, and builders are typical classes in a bullywug society. They are governed by a king or queen, who is usually the largest and strongest of the warrior caste. The royalty rules according to their attitude and morality, which can range from a friendly monarchy to a hostile dictatorship.
There are a few bullywug towns that are more advanced; some boasting studies in mathematics, physics, metalworking, and engineering. There are even rumors of a few bullywug castles guarded by heavily armored knights. Wealthy kings and queens are waited on by servants and peasants, following more feudalistic-like social organization.

trait.name: Adaptions
trait.text:
Bullywugs survive in many different living conditions: untamed jungles, lush forests, wetlands, and even deep underground. As such, their bodies have also adapted to suit these conditions, producing an incredible amount of variety in size, color, and ability.
Bullywugs usually thrive near water. Their strong legs and long, webbed feet make them wonderful swimmers, but hinder their movement on land. They developed their ability to jump as a result, so they can chase down their quarry, or escape a predator.
Bullywugs can pass air through their throats, filling a flexible membrane that bellows out and amplifies their noise. They can speak with one another up to 500 feet away.

trait.name: Reasons to Adventure
trait.text:
Greed is the compelling reason to adventure. A clanless bullywug feels free to take for themselves, instead of for a king or queen. Initially, their hunger for the accumulation of wealth is ravenous. As they become used to their freedom, this can dissipate. However, some set out to find treasure for their ruler, in the hopes of achieving a higher social rank on their return.
The quest for power is a hallmark of the bullywug social order. Finding power in personal strength, wealth, or magical ability fits in nicely with bullywug aspirations.
There are a few "free thinking" bullywugs who adventure for other reasons, such as giving money to charity, defending friends or their town, or overthrowing local evil.

trait.name: Bullywug Names
trait.text:
Bullywugs have names that contain clicks, growls, and throaty, raspy consonant sounds.
Examples of bullywug names: Kek'kek, Jrr'mya, Krr'mit, Budd, Wyyze, Err, and Rrr'bet.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: Bullywugs are considered full-grown at 3 years of age. The average lifespan of a bullywug is 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Bullywugs can be of any alignment, but tend to be chaotic and evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Your size is Medium, however bullywugs vary in size and weight. Most are about 4 to 5 feet tall and weight 80 to 120 pounds.

trait.name: Swim speed
trait.text: You have a base swimming speed of 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The large, circular eardrum behind your eyes is extremely sensitive to sound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in Dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern colros in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
The horned bullywugs are larger than most bullywugs, and are green or tan, with brown spots. They have unique horn-like projections that protrude over the tops of their eyes, often resulting in an intimidating appearance.
Source: Bullywugs p. 5 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Menacing Facade
trait.text: You have proficiency in Intimidation.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Poisondart bullywugs are the smallest and the most beautiful of the bullywugs. Their skin ranges from dazzling reds, breathtaking blues and iridescent golds. Their bright skin warns others of its poisonous nature.
Source: Bullywugs p. 5 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Social Structure
trait.text:

They are governed by a king or queen, who is usually the largest and strongest of the warrior caste. The royalty rules according to their attitude and morality, which can range from a friendly monarchy to a hostile dictatorship.
There are a few bullywug towns that are more advanced; some boasting studies in mathematics, physics, metalworking, and engineering. There are even rumors of a few bullywug castles guarded by heavily armored knights. trait.name: Age
trait.text: Bullywugs are considered full-grown at 3 years of age. The average lifespan of a bullywug is 50 years.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Bullywugs can be of any alignment, but tend to be chaotic and evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Your size is Medium, however bullywugs vary in size and weight. Most are about 4 to 5 feet tall and weight 80 to 120 pounds.

trait.name: Swim speed
trait.text: You have a base swimming speed of 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The large, circular eardrum behind your eyes is extremely sensitive to sound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Poison Resistant
trait.text: You have resistance to poison damage.

trait.name: Poison Darts
trait.text: You are proficient with darts and blowguns. You can apply poison to a number of darts or blowgun darts up to your Charisma modifier by rubbing them on your skin. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to DC 10 + your Charisma modifier or take 1d4 + your Charisma modifier poison damage.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Toad bullywugs are the largest of all bullywugs. Their drab, dry, bumpy skin and bloated features also make them the ugliest of the bullywugs. What they lack in beauty, they make up for in sheer toughness.
Source: Bullywugs p. 6 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Sticky Tongue
trait.text: Your long, sticky tongue lets you grab items that are up to 10 feet away. Furthermore, it gives you advantage when initiating a grappling attack action.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.

trait.name: Description
trait.text:
Bullywugs are medium-sized, frog-like humanoids with wet skin, strong legs, and the ability to breathe underwater.
Tree bullywugs have light-green bodies, with bright red eyes and orange feet. They have slender, sleek builds and long fingers that make them adapt climbers.
Source: Bullywugs p. 5 (Homebrew), Dungeon Master's Guide (2014) p. 282

trait.name: Habitat
trait.text: Bullywugs are amphibious: They are equally comfortable with life on land, as they are underwater.

trait.text: Bullywugs are considered full-grown at 3 years of age. The average lifespan of a bullywug is 50 years.

trait.text: Bullywugs can be of any alignment, but tend to be chaotic and evil.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Your size is Medium, however bullywugs vary in size and weight. Most are about 4 to 5 feet tall and weight 80 to 120 pounds.

trait.name: Swim speed
trait.text: You have a base swimming speed of 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: You can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
trait.text: The large, circular eardrum behind your eyes is extremely sensitive to sound. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Underwater Weapon Proficiency.
trait.text: You are familiar with weapons that can be used underwater. You have proficiencies with daggers, javelins, shortswords, spears and tridents.

trait.name: Adept Climber
trait.text: Using all four of your appendages, you can climb up, down and across vertical surfaces, and upside-down along ceilings.

trait.name: Tree Bullywug Weapon Training
trait.text: Being from the forest, you have proficiency with the following wooden weapons: clubs, greatclubs, shortbows and longbows.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak Bullywug and Common.
